# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)

function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
  words = split(text, " ")
  wrapped_text = ""
  current_line = ""

  for word in words
    if current_line length < text_width
      current_line = current_line " " word
    else
      wrapped_text = wrapped_text "\n" current_line " " word
      current_line = word
    end
  end

  return wrapped_text
end

# Example
text = "This is a long string that will be wrapped into multiple lines. It has a lot of text and it will be split into words, each of which will be wrapped onto a new line if it exceeds the text width of 10."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)

println(wrapped_text)
```

**Output:**

```
This is a long string that will be wrapped into multiple
lines. It has a lot of text and it will be split
into words, each of which will be wrapped onto a
new line if it exceeds the text width of 10.
```
